header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 04/2019 (Deepak Kisan Pawar etc 1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­003743­2018

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest under C.R.No. 1104 of 2018, registered with Satara City police Station at the instance for alleged commission of offence punishable under sections 436, 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and hence they approached Court seeking pre­arrest bail.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code
under sections 436, 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2) It is stated that, complainant Chandrakant Narayan Atpadkar is tenant in the shop owned by present applicant. There is dispute between original owner Pawar and applicant no.1 and on 9.12.2018, due to previous enmity, both applicants thrown explosive liquid in the shop of complainant and caused damage to the property by mischief by fire. Therefore, the complainant filed the complaint.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is stated that, complainant Chandrakant Narayan Atpadkar is tenant in the shop owned by present applicant.

There is dispute between original owner Pawar and applicant no.1 and on 9.12.2018, due to previous enmity, both applicants thrown explosive liquid in the shop of complainant and caused damage to the property by mischief by fire.
Therefore, the complainant filed the complaint.

arguments.text: 3) The application is strongly opposed on the ground that, there was dispute between applicant and informant in respect of City Survey No. 281 and on that count, applicants set on fire the articles kept in the shop with intent to vacate the said place and thereby caused damage.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The application is strongly opposed on the ground that, there was dispute between applicant and informant in respect of City Survey No. 281 and on that count, applicants set on fire the articles kept in the shop with intent to vacate the said place and thereby caused damage.

arguments.text: 4) Heard Advocate Shri. Chikane on behalf of the applicants. It is submitted that, applicants are innocent and have no concerned with the offence, the complainant has falsely implicated both the applicants in order to keep the property with him. Applicants have been granted interim anticipatory bail, and they are cooperating with the police, in investigation. Hence, application be granted.

argumentSentences.text: Chikane on behalf of the applicants.
It is submitted that, applicants are innocent and have no concerned with the offence, the complainant has falsely implicated both the applicants in order to keep the property with him.
Applicants have been granted interim anticipatory bail, and they are cooperating with the police, in investigation.

arguments.text: 5) I have perused the police papers. The informant is not eye­witness to the incident, it is alleged that, accused had property dispute with his uncle, but he made statement that, he has no dispute with accused persons regarding the property. Even his statement before police is in said manner. Considering submissions, accused may be granted anticipatory bail and interim order may be confirmed with conditions mentioned therein with one more condition that, they should not leave Satara City without prior permission of the I.O. Hence, the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) I have perused the police papers.

The informant is not eye­witness to the incident, it is alleged that, accused had property dispute with his uncle, but he made statement that, he has no dispute with accused persons regarding the property.
Even his statement before police is in said manner.

Considering submissions, accused may be granted anticipatory bail and interim order may be confirmed with conditions mentioned therein with one more condition that, they should not leave Satara City without prior permission of the I.O. Hence, the following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 04 of 2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 03.01.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions mentioned therein, with one more condition that, applicants should not leave Satara City without prior permission of the Investigation Officer till filing of the charge­sheet.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 24th January, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 04/2019 (Deepak Kisan Pawar etc 1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­003743­2018 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest under C.R.No. 1104 of 2018, registered with Satara City police Station at the instance for alleged commission of offence punishable under sections 436, 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and hence they approached Court seeking pre­arrest bail. 
---background-ends---
2) It is stated that, complainant Chandrakant Narayan Atpadkar is tenant in the shop owned by present applicant. There is dispute between original owner Pawar and applicant no.1 and on 9.12.2018, due to previous enmity, both applicants thrown explosive liquid in the shop of complainant and caused damage to the property by mischief by fire. Therefore, the complainant filed the complaint. 
---argument-ends---
3) The application is strongly opposed on the ground that, there was dispute between applicant and informant in respect of City Survey No. 281 and on that count, applicants set on fire the articles kept in the shop with intent to vacate the said place and thereby caused damage. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard Advocate Shri. Chikane on behalf of the applicants. It is submitted that, applicants are innocent and have no concerned with the offence, the complainant has falsely implicated both the applicants in order to keep the property with him. Applicants have been granted interim anticipatory bail, and they are cooperating with the police, in investigation. Hence, application be granted. 
---argument-ends---
5) I have perused the police papers. The informant is not eye­witness to the incident, it is alleged that, accused had property dispute with his uncle, but he made statement that, he has no dispute with accused persons regarding the property. Even his statement before police is in said manner. Considering submissions, accused may be granted anticipatory bail and interim order may be confirmed with conditions mentioned therein with one more condition that, they should not leave Satara City without prior permission of the I.O. Hence, the following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 04 of 2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 03.01.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions mentioned therein, with one more condition that, applicants should not leave Satara City without prior permission of the Investigation Officer till filing of the charge­sheet. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 24th January, 2019. Satara
